title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: From this point Union Street,the principal avenue of approach from the south,runs in a straight line for half a mile, crossing by anoble arch Den Burn, on the sides of which " thecanny folk" bleach their linens ; and from it alsodiverge the other smaller streets rather abruptlyon the hill side towards the harbour, (which is veryspacious, and has a fine pier,) but more diffuselyover the back ground, towards the country andOld Aberdeen.
